newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH MUNI BOND TO START OTC TRADE IN MARCH.
newsitem.headline: POLISH MUNI BOND TO START OTC TRADE IN MARCH.

text.p: Polish town Ostrow Wielkopolski this month will launch on the CTO regulated over-the-counter market its 7.5-million-zloty bond issue as the country's first publicly traded municipal bond, the head of the OTC firm said.

Czeslaw Gawlowski, the president of Centralna Tabela Ofert SA which manages OTC trade, told a news conference on Thursday that Ostrow's four-year bonds would start trade between March 15 and March 27.
Ostrow president Miroslaw Kruszynski, also present, said the western Polish town planned to launch another 7.5-million- zloty issue later this year, which would also be traded on the OTC market.
Kruszynski said the issue would likely have a maturity exceeding four years.
